89F925BDCECC4AC985F24273CC38C427.description: LA10.E.41: acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression

57D5D73F116B400199785DD9DBE75A9E.description: LA10.E.40.b: analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations

C7617FE3BFC84421A62B4D329F0AE126.description: LA10.E.40.a: interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role in the text

2818D7EB0676412286DA9CFBD982155E.description: LA10.E.40: demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings

973138EAC4A74365B02ABD95A64B8C77.description: LA10.E.39.e: verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary)

AD659E856E2D4386ABF5C9B1D31E4CC5.description: LA10.E.39.d: consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, or its etymology

D3C204B416814220BEDAE2D096391B61.description: LA10.E.39.c: identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., analyze, analysis, analytical; advocate, advocacy)

BF569AF81D3747158AF9DF51DB13671F.description: LA10.E.39.b: use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin roots as clues to the meanings of words or phrases (e.g., conduct, conducive, conduit)

C9C211691E3943D592B750170760C35E.description: LA10.E.39.a: use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word's position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase

5401AC76A93B4D53A2D9E7A22E8D1EF8.description: LA10.E.39: determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 9-10 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies

A7DD4B22FE8643B7919400CCF7A52C4F.description: LA10.E.38.a: write and edit work so that it conforms to the guidelines in a style manual (e.g., MLA Handbook, Turabian's Manual for Writers) appropriate for the discipline and writing type

BD8F2D03A37645AAA2C480F52D7487D2.description: LA10.E.38: apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening

63E0989A1A904A3CAF8D499D38729861.description: LA10.E.37.b: use a colon to introduce a list or quotation

8543741E4A6E49618DC08544536A3426.description: LA10.E.37.a: use a semicolon (and perhaps a conjunctive adverb) to link two or more closely related independent clauses

3D365C28705C492F89DF8CB7F3D27114.description: LA10.E.37: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing

75351AF72B7D48F295C7DD4EE0109639.description: LA10.E.36.b: use various types of phrases (noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional, absolute) and clauses (independent, dependent; noun, relative, adverbial) to convey specific meanings and add variety and interest to writing or presentations

C56CEF5BF0FE44B0AAAFB6D9C48FE0FF.description: LA10.E.36: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

726AF66EAA6A4664AF5050980920F44F.description: LA10.D.35: adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate

84C32045C01E4492908A8C2DE008BA77.description: LA10.D.34: make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest

2CEC1A3A3C8D42159B83DAE80DB27A95.description: LA10.D.33: present information, findings, and supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience, and task

0B06D2934099448F96A9BE3E9348E2C6.description: LA10.D.32: evaluate and/or reflect on a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric, identifying any fallacious reasoning or exaggerated or distorted evidence

D280A8C18BE945EF86F5492679D81655.description: LA10.D.31: integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source

75347DB6B287418FBC94D724878C641A.description: LA10.D.30.d: respond thoughtfully to diverse perspectives, summarize points of agreement and disagreement, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views and understanding and make new connections in light of the evidence and reasoning presented

CFA9A3516DDD4BF1AB99557C5965A634.description: LA10.D.30.c: propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that relate the current discussion to broader themes or larger ideas; actively incorporate others into the discussion; and clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions

455E2405485C478FB5DFE4A9E4539614.description: LA10.D.30.b: work with peers to set rules for collegial discussions and decision-making (e.g., informal consensus, taking votes on key issues, presentation of alternate views), clear goals and deadlines, and individual roles as needed

044DFA7A6A0340A9ABE102DCE23B6CAB.description: LA10.D.30.a: come to discussions prepared, having read and researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence from texts and other research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well-reasoned exchange of ideas

D5DFE00F14F64A21820D5BCA13411A3D.description: LA10.D.30: initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g., one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grades 9-10 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively

6488FF71DA114A34B3449028D7C4D922.description: LA10.C.29: write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences

C3BF5120ACFB46CEB21345A4887AE60E.description: LA10.C.28.f: produce a written reflection to informational texts that reflects on the meaning and value of a piece of writing

60FDD505E4C843219C2936EDABCB45D9.description: LA10.C.28.e: produce a written reflection to literature and literary nonfiction that reflects on the meaning and value of a piece of writing

DDB4F553147D4B408D3A9AA36A8B0D17.description: LA10.C.28.d: produce a written critical analysis to informational texts that draws evidence from the text

E5BFBBC2C9BA4AF4A85B556C1B232EC6.description: LA10.C.28.c: produce a written critical analysis to literature and literary nonfiction that draws evidence from the text

A2497FF71A25471392E876DCB24BD450.description: LA10.C.28.b: apply grades 9-10 reading standards to informational texts (e.g., delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning)

0C0B7B80F524495F8F56536E91BEB42F.description: LA10.C.28.a: apply grades 9-10 reading standards to literature and literary nonfiction (e.g., analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work [e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare])

113D71317D2B489C8B41BB4B4A16BDE9.description: LA10.C.28: draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

2CBF4EC2EA264EC1B7B7400485318137.description: LA10.C.27: gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citations

98E814341ABA42E1A5E5C9BE89AB1A10.description: LA10.C.26: conduct short, as well as more sustained, research projects to answer questions (including self-generated questions) or solve problems; narrow or broaden the inquiries when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subjects, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

5A10A5AC5C5249F88039375E42B3A354.description: LA10.C.25: use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products, taking advantage of technology's capacity to link to other information and to display information flexibly and dynamically

0F0AD3D8E6E04A30878181733B01A24F.description: LA10.C.24: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience

A10DD96FD7FF42F1A414028B7B63D4D2.description: LA10.C.23: produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

E7873CB2EA24470BB5EC6B99CC03F92F.description: LA10.C.22.e: provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative

3BE81C97312A432689A14F0552F80558.description: LA10.C.22.d: use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters

85F701B25BFD4234B8FE5826ADF4693E.description: LA10.C.22.c: use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole

B556E7373ECA480DAF61DEF30EA4FF8B.description: LA10.C.22.b: use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters

DF4086ABFB52448A86764005F5F8C3A9.description: LA10.C.22.a: engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events

987564680A924C7F9A4494D90BB3B876.description: LA10.C.22: write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events, using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences

89E3E7F694F64CB9A9B5D95A65B4394A.description: LA10.C.21.g: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic)

1493AC3906164F17A82567444B5A4A8D.description: LA10.C.21.f: use documents to clarify details or support claims

B822BFEFD98E45678EDC3B144AC076D9.description: LA10.C.21.e: establish and maintain an appropriate style and objective tone

0F2D8EACD20C490DB0A8908AAD21F468.description: LA10.C.21.d: use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic

ADFFB7DB0A2C42FFBE3F5DCD03E5CFBD.description: LA10.C.21.c: use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

2A5CBCB923A74D5F8FF923A7C622C983.description: LA10.C.21.b: develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic

9091F3AC999B4DC6A3D46ABF581E9FA3.description: LA10.C.21.a: introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make important connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension

A9775FD78B7F48F2846CB68EFE376C5D.description: LA10.C.21: write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content

137C36570A0146ED99523D0231E28ED8.description: LA10.C.20.e: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented

D2A9595276BF4B028714CF103FA2E71C.description: LA10.C.20.d: establish and maintain an appropriate style and objective tone, while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing

E8EA4F7A9C594FCFBBB91F1170C0E0E1.description: LA10.C.20.c: use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims

BB7E1C5351924876885C0E7E4909E65F.description: LA10.C.20.b: develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience's knowledge level and concerns

E0D0B2BB3B78403EB975A5C32DE14BA5.description: LA10.C.20.a: introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence

FBAA5A63C8FF42EBAE21A3B0F1608D90.description: LA10.C.20: write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence

459DF9A78B624990BA6429AA61DFE780.description: LA10.B.19: read and comprehend informational texts at the high end of the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently, by the end of grade 10

B537E55267FF41148E881234A1957A76.description: LA10.B.18.a: relate a literary work to primary source documents of its literary period or historical setting

AD78994A280D4F919D684F020C082C00.description: LA10.B.18: analyze seminal U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (e.g., Washington's Farewell Address, the Gettysburg Address, Roosevelt's Four Freedoms speech, King's "Letter from Birmingham Jail," Nelson Mandela's Nobel Peace Prize Speech, The Universal Declaration of Human Rights), including how they address related themes and concepts

FC921787EEA548DBA485D3388F91E19D.description: LA10.B.17: delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning

6D3108A997494C83A88329C688C2A8E8.description: LA10.B.16: analyze various accounts of a subject told in different mediums (e.g., a person's life story in both print and multimedia), determining which details are emphasized in each account

03C9EBB74AB64288A46C304FBDB81F70.description: LA10.B.15: determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose

BE0B522960584AA9A8A80EFBB413351E.description: LA10.B.14: analyze in detail how an author's ideas or claims are developed and refined by particular sentences, paragraphs, or larger portions of a text (e.g., a section or chapter)

0475029756DE42018B628CA9EAA66BD4.description: LA10.B.13: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper)

7DB3DF5ED5A14A93BEF03FE1F37A31E9.description: LA10.B.12: analyze how the author unfolds an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that are drawn between them

8E8CC9EB2BAC4F179B353DCAA29FF9A2.description: LA10.B.11: determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text

26CF8ED701B04B2EAF8D22B8E7F97AB2.description: LA10.B.10: cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text

AF4618A67B27454F947C099B7F3C5D90.description: LA10.A.9.a: analyze the structures and elements of world literature

BDAB40DAD89942788C396C6766DB165F.description: LA10.A.9: read and comprehend literature and literary nonfiction, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range, by the end of grade 10

925BD9C5FCE3414E91E5616CC38E3C95.description: LA10.A.8: analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work (e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare)

9C2A0824B86E43D38B48CDCA6434E31F.description: LA10.A.7: analyze the representation of a subject or a key scene in two different artistic mediums (e.g., Auden's poem "Musee des Beaux Arts" and Breughel's painting Landscape with the Fall of Icarus), including what is emphasized or absent in each treatment

CD88A89F877D4A99944A848C05C022D9.description: LA10.A.6: analyze a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature from outside the United States, drawing on a wide reading of world literature

C4CCC28FEBE14091B465F5CAB2021CFE.description: LA10.A.5: analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within it (e.g., parallel plots), and manipulate time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create such effects as mystery, tension, or surprise

BF5CC3C25AF748638BDAA13656E60AC3.description: LA10.A.4: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language evokes a sense of time and place; how it sets a formal or informal tone)

39D9F70ABC214CE5868C7475A4E5EE14.description: LA10.A.3: analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a text, interact with other characters, and advance the plot or develop the theme

869175057BF24C62BE6F546353D10DF6.description: LA10.A.2: determine a theme or central idea of text and closely analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text

E59A37696ACE4E4C9C32E262792A2CBA.description: LA10.A.1: cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text
